info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 5:42AM EDT until August 19 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and northern Indiana, including the following counties, in north central Indiana, St. Joseph. In northern Indiana, La Porte.
* WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT /845 AM CDT/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 AM EDT /440 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Thunderstorms this morning will affect areas that have already received heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours. Minor flooding is expected this morning. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen since yesterday afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Bend, Mishawaka, Michigan City, La Porte, Westville, Georgetown, Trail Creek, Gulivoire Park, New Carlisle, Long Beach, Roseland, Pottawattamie Park, Michiana Shores, Kingsbury, Indian Village, Rolling Prairie, Hudson Lake, Byron, Fish Lake and Stillwell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT /845 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: La Porte, IN; St. Joseph, IN
